title: Label

verbs: Attach a tag or label to
To apply a marker to content or items (like photos or text) to identify certain types of information.
nouns: A contract of sale is a legal contract an exchange of goods, services or property to be exchanged from seller to buyer for an agreed upon value in money paid or the promise to pay same.
An agreement (or contract) in which property is transferred from the seller (vendor) to the buyer (vendee) for a fixed price in money (paid or agreed to be paid by the buyer)
An exchange of goods or services for currency or credit.

A contract that involves an exchange of goods, services or property to be exchanged from seller (or vendor) to buyer (or purchaser) for an agreed upon value in money (or money equivalent) paid or the promise to pay same.

A source document that documents an agreement between two or more parties based on an understanding that a selling party will commit to selling a specific quantity or value of product over a period of time in exchange for favorable prices and discounts.
Exchange of goods or services for currency or credit.
A contract with the target of the change in ownership (of goods, services, companies, etc)
A brief description given for purposes of identification
A label written or printed on paper, cardboard, or plastic that is attached to something to indicate its owner, nature, price, etc.
A slip of paper that entitles the owner to use a means of public transport such as trains or buses.

description:
A light-brown or yellow rectangular tag, as labelled and attached to a key. Depicted at various angles punched with a hole, generally with a metal ring or loop of string.

Commonly used to represent a price tag or metadata tag as well as for various senses of label.

WhatsApp's is white. Apple removed its ring from earlier designs. Samsung previously featured the easter egg initials HMJ, while Google's design previously featured two tags.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the label emoji presents as a crisp, white rectangular tag with a small, neatly punched hole at the top, hinting at its attachment to items. Apple's signature glossy 3D shading creates subtle depth and a slight sheen, making it appear almost tangible. This emoji is frequently used to signify identification, pricing, or a specific item being pointed out in digital conversations.
